results.title: Un type comme moi ne devrait jamais mourir = A Guy Like Me Should Never Die
results.brief_description:
Leopold is an investment broker who is so opposed to war that he transfers his entire personal portfolio into chocolates, reasoning that this is a product that can never be turned to war-like use. One day, Leopold feels the need to break his old routine and leaves wife and career behind in order to meditate on the meaning of life.

Credits: Producer, Bernard Lenteric ; director, Michel Vianey ; writer, Michel Vianey ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Mort Schuman.
Cast: Jean-Michel Folon, Francine Racette, Bernard Fresson, Mort Schuman, Henri Garcin, Pierre Barouh, Bernadette Lafont.

results.title: Un Inconnu Nomme Eiffel
results.brief_description:
Gustave Eiffel was afraid that his famous tower would overshadow his other accomplishments. This short film sets out to shed light on a very prolific international engineering career which included the building of railway bridges, viaducts and the metal frame of the Statue of Liberty.

Credits: Director, Joan Laskoff ; photography, Jacques Mercanton ; music, Betty Willemetz.

results.title: Un Homme Qui Dort = a Man Who Sleeps
results.brief_description:
A student refuses to carry on with his studies and decides to live ‘in neutral time’ or at the limit of schizophrenia. Reference: Film Index International.

Credits: Director, Bernard Queysanne ; writers, Bernard Queysanne, Georges Perec ; photography, Bernard Zitzermann ; music, Philippe Drogoz, Eugenie Kuffler.
Cast: Jacques Spiesser, Ludmila Mikael.

results.title: Un Bon Petit Diable = a Sweet Little Devil
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Brialy, Eve Vercel and Robert Nador
results.brief_description:
Charles is an orphan who lives with the cruel Mrs.Leontine MacMiche. Not content at mistreating the child, MacMiche has also stolen his inheritance. Charles’ only allies are Betsy, the maid and Juliette, Charles’ blind cousin.

Credits: Producers, Robert Nador, Eve Vercel ; director, Jean-Claude Brialy ; writers, Jean-Claude Brialy, Didier Decoin ; photography, Jean-Francois Robin ; music, Eric Demarsan.
Cast: Alice Sapritch, Bernadette Lafont, Philippe Clay, Michel Creton, Paul Courtois.

results.title: Un Amour a Paris = a Romance in Paris
results.brief_description:
This is an ‘amour fou’ story about two strangers who meet and fall in love in Paris. Marie, is a young Jewish girl from Algeria who comes to Paris with the hope of becoming a model. She is sidetracked when she meets Ali, a French-born Algerian, who has just been released from a 3 year stint in jail. Ali makes plans to meet up with an accomplice to get his share of the money from a robbery in order to travel to Houston,Texas, and become a ‘cosmonaut’. Further reading: ‘Questions of identity in Beur cinema: from ‘Tea in the harem’ to ‘Cheb”. Screen, 34: 4 (Winter 1993): pp 321-342.

Credits: Director, Merzak Allouache ; writer, Merzak Allouache ; photography, Jean-Claude Larrieu ; music, Jean-Marie Senia.
Cast: Karim Allaoui, Catherine Wilkening, Juliet Berto, Muriel Combeau, Dany Cohn-Bendit.

results.creator_credit: Acorn Films and Walter Reade Organization
results.brief_description:
Outlines care and usage of the typewriter. Also maintenance of the electric typewriter.
Suitable for lower and middle secondary level.

results.title: Two out
results.brief_description: Utilising only one shot and a series of dissolves and jump cuts, this powerful short film examines the relationship between two men who share a single gaol cell. When the subject of the lack of the female object emerges, the tiny space they inhabit erupts into violence and frustrated desire.

results.title: Two architects
results.creator_credit: Ron Parks and British Aluminium Company
results.brief_description: James Gowan and James Stirling discuss the design philosophy and building problems of the award-winning Department of Engineering, Leicester University. The lightly balanced tower of laboratories and offices, engineering workshops and cantilevered lecture halls were built on a difficult site to demanding functional and cost specifications.

results.title: Twelve like you
results.brief_description: Twelve women of varied circumstances describe their career development experiences and suggest how to set goals and take advantage of career opportunities. Some of their achievements include Retail Store Manager, Bank Branch Manager, Telephone Company Technician, Hospital Adminstrator, Equal Opportunity Director, Research Analyst and Deputy District Attorney. Emphasis is given to planning and the determination to succeed against all odds. Introduction and commentary by Jerry Kramer.
